description:
'''Quiet storm''' is a [[radio format]] and genre of [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], performed in a smooth, romantic, [[jazz]]-influenced style. It was named after the title song on [[Smokey Robinson]]'s 1975 album ''[[A Quiet Storm]]''.{{sfn|King|2007|p=180}}

The radio format was pioneered in 1976 by [[Melvin Lindsey]], while he was an [[intern]] at the [[Washington, D.C.]] [[radio station]] [[WHUR-FM]]. It eventually became regarded as an identifiable subgenre of R&B.{{sfn|Ripani|2006|p=132}} Quiet storm was marketed primarily to upscale mature African-American audiences. It peaked in popularity during the 1980s, but fell out of favor with young listeners in the [[golden age hip hop|golden age of hip hop]].{{sfn|King|2007|p=181}}
